domain
Class Animated

java.lang.Object
  domain.Sprite
      domain.Animated
All Implemented Interfaces:
Renderable, Updatable, Collisionable, Movable, Statitzable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AIControlled, UserControlled
public abstract class Animated
extends Sprite
implements Movable

This Specialitzation class represents a Sprite wich has the ability of moving. That's why it implements the Movable interface and it's methods.

Animated

Default constructor. It calls super(); and initializes the lastMovementTime field.

                   int height,
                   int zIndex)
Constructor. It calls super(Point relativeToScreen, int width, int height, int zIndex); and initializes the lastMovementTime field.

Parameters:
relativeToScreen - The point at wich the upper-left animated sprite corner will be screen allocated.
width - The width of the Animated sprite
height - The height of the Animated sprite
zIndex - The zIndex of the Animated sprite

Method Detail

setXIncrement

public void setXIncrement(int xIncrement)
This method sets the xIncrement value.

Specified by:
setXIncrement in interface Movable
Parameters:
xIncrement - the new xIncrement that the Animated sprite will move

setYIncrement

public void setYIncrement(int yIncrement)
This method sets the yIncrement value.

Specified by:
setYIncrement in interface Movable
Parameters:
yIncrement - the new yIncrement that the Animated sprite will move

stop

public void stop()
Stop animated sprite. This method sets the xIncrement and yIncrement fields to 0, causing the Animated sprite suddenly being stopped.

Specified by:
stop in interface Movable

setSpeed

public void setSpeed(int speed)
This method sets the moveInterval field value. That's useful when you want to make movements go slowly.

Specified by:
setSpeed in interface Movable
Parameters:
speed - The time interval in milliseconds at wich each move process should be performed.

examineCurrentDirection

protected Collisions.CollisionDirection examineCurrentDirection()
This method calculate the current Animated sprite direction using it's x and y increments.

Returns:
The CollisionDirection that this Animated sprite is currently producing.
See Also:
Collisions.CollisionDirection

moveCheckingScenarioCollisions

protected void moveCheckingScenarioCollisions(Collisions.CollisionDirection direction)
This method is used to make the Animated instance moving taking care of the Scenario Limits and collisionable areas. Depending on it's current direction, both, x, y, or any increments will be applied. All the collisionable areas that this Animated instance have will be translated to the new location too.

Parameters:
direction - The current direction of the Animated sprite.
See Also:
Collisions.CollisionDirection, Collisions.checkScenarioCollisionableAreasCollision(domain.interfaces.Collisionable, domain.Collisions.CollisionDirection, domain.Scenario), Collisions.checkScenarioLimitsCollision(domain.interfaces.Collisionable, domain.Collisions.CollisionDirection, domain.Scenario)

move

public void move()
This method makes the Animated instance moving. It checks if the moveInterval has been passed since the last movement. If it has been, then the Animated will move taking care of the Scenario limits and collisionable Areas.

Specified by:
move in interface Movable
See Also:
moveCheckingScenarioCollisions(domain.Collisions.CollisionDirection), examineCurrentDirection()

update

public void update()
This method overrides the Sprite.update(). It first invoke super.update() to avoid the loss of super update processes and then make a call to the move() method.

Specified by:
update in interface Updatable
Overrides:
update in class Sprite
See Also:
Sprite.update(), move()
